basics.name: Rushil Venkateswar
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: I'm an enthusiastic and hard-working individual, capable of undertaking responsibilities head-on and completing them on time. Problem solving and mathematics are two things that allure me, which is reflected in the fields that I have tried to explore, i.e. ML, DL and Competitive Programming. Through the coursework at CSE IITKgp, I am becoming proficient at learning new concepts in a short duration of time and at programming. To conclude, I look forward to working with firms and learning more about my interests and accomplishing our common goals.

work.name: ISRO
work.description: Semantic Segmentation of Remote Sensing Images
work.summary: Created a lightweight Tensorflow model based on U-Net architecture for semantic segmentation.
highlights: Studied existing literature on CNNs, deep learning and their usage in the remote sensing context.
Using the Tensorflow framework, built a U-Net like model with improved performance and a fraction of the number of parameters as the original U-Net.
Created various other scripts to perform inference on variable sized images. Tested on Indian context images taken from Google Earth.

work.name: Inter-IIT Tech Meet 11.0
work.summary: Part of the solo gold-winning team, representing IIT Kharagpur in the 11th edition of Inter-IIT Tech Meet.
highlights: Worked on extraction of overlapping data between TMC-2 and OHRC images.
As part of the DL team, we implemented a Lunar Turing GAN model.

volunteer.summary: Guiding a group of 3 first-year students and helping them academically and otherwise.

awards.title: Optiver Winter School
awards.summary: Selected for the Winter School out of 3000 IITians.

awards.title: Inter-IIT Tech Meet 11.0
awards.summary: Won the gold medal in the Chandrayaan Moon Mapping Challenge.

projects.name: Miss Direction
projects.description: A mapping engine that misguides you
highlights: Built by all women team of newbie programmers
Using modern technologies such as GoogleMaps, Chrome Extension and Javascript
